definition: half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half

sentences.english: On the left is M97 in the constellation Ursa Major, also known in the northern hemisphere as the Owl Nebula.
sentences.chinese: 左边是M97在大熊座，又称北半球的夜枭星云。

sentences.english: The northern ice cap on Mars is nearly divided into two by a huge division named Chasma Boreale.
sentences.chinese: 火星北半球的冰冠几乎被宏伟的博勒拉峡谷一劈为二。

sentences.english: In the northern hemisphere, this meteor shower should be observed 3 hours before sunrise.
sentences.chinese: 在北半球，本次流星雨应在日出前3小时投入观测。

sentences.english: It's also called the Autumn Star, by us inhabiting the northern part of Earth's globe.
sentences.chinese: 因为我们住在北半球，也称它为秋天的星星。

sentences.english: Airline-passenger flow in the Northern Hemisphere is shown in these annual snapshots.
sentences.chinese: 这些年度报表展示了北半球的航班客流量。

sentences.english: And then came summer, with heat-waves across much of the Northern Hemisphere.
sentences.chinese: 接着夏天到来，热浪席卷了北半球的大部分地区。

sentences.english: Subsequent discoveries suggest an ozone hole may be forming in the Northern Hemisphere.
sentences.chinese: 后来的发现表明北半球可能在形成一个臭氧洞。

sentences.english: But he waited until one day after the northern Spring equinox, in 2001, to photograph the striking view.
sentences.chinese: 但他是等到北半球春分之后一天拍的，2001年。

sentences.english: Southward invasion polar cold air mass continued to dominate the Northern Hemisphere's climate.
sentences.chinese: 极地冷气团不断南侵，主宰了北半球的气候。

sentences.english: Japan lies in the mid latitudes of the Northern Hemisphere, as does the United States.
sentences.chinese: 日本与美国一样，位于北半球中纬度。

sentences.english: In the northern hemisphere we are now entering the peak period for seasonal flu.
sentences.chinese: 在北半球，我们现正进入季节性流感的高峰期。

sentences.english: Asymmetric auroral intensities in the Earth's Northern and Southern hemispheres .
sentences.chinese: 北半球和南半球的不对称极光强度。

sentences.english: Collected here are a handful of recent images of early autumn around the northern half of our world.
sentences.chinese: 以下呈现给各位的是北半球初秋降临人间的景象。

sentences.english: It's something you would use during the warm season, in the summer in the northern hemisphere.
sentences.chinese: 有时候暖季也会用上，例如在北半球的夏季的时候。

sentences.english: Acer plants belong to Aceraceae which mainly produced in temperate zone of north earth.
sentences.chinese: 槭属植物属槭树科主产于北半球温带地区。

sentences.english: It is spring in northern Mars, but no birds are singing.
sentences.chinese: 火星的北半球正值春季，但我们听不到鸟儿歌唱。

definition: equator (of the earth or astronomical body)
perihelion, the nearest point of a planet in elliptic orbit to the sun/lower apsis
aphelion, the furthest point of a planet in elliptic orbit to the sun/opposite: perihelion 近日點|近日点[jin4 ri4 dian3]/higher apsis
Xiazhi or Summer Solstice, 10th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 21st June-6th July
